TermDefinition.DefinitionText: A disorder in which a person is born without part or all of the iris (colored tissue at the front of the eyeball). Aniridia usually affects both eyes and causes other eye problems, including being sensitive to light and loss of vision.

SpanishTermDefinition.DefinitionText: Trastorno por el que una persona nace sin iris (tejido de color en la parte anterior del ojo) o sin una parte de este. La aniridia suele afectar ambos ojos y causar otros problemas oculares, como sensibilidad a la luz y pérdida de visión.

RelatedInformation.RelatedExternalRef: Aniridia (Genetic and Rare Diseases Information Center)
